content.mainTitle: Narada Briefs Valmiki About Rama & Ramayana In A Nutshell
content.subTitle: 0 Shlokas

content.english: Ascetic Valmiki enquired of Narada, preeminent among the sages ever engaged in the practice of religious austerities or study of the Vedas and best among the eloquent.
content.sanskrit: [Saint Narada visits hermitage of Valmiki -- Valmiki queries about a single perfect individual bestowed with all good qualities enumerated by him -- Narada, knower of past, present and future, identifies such a man -- describes virtues, qualities of Sri Rama -- narrates briefly the story of his life.]तपस्स्वाध्यायनिरतं तपस्वी वाग्विदां वरम् ।नारदं परिपप्रच्छ वाल्मीकिर्मुनिपुङ्गवम् ।।1.1.1।।
content.hindi: तपस्वी वाल्मीकिजी ने तपस्या और स्वाध्याय में लगे हुए विद्वानों में श्रेष्ठ मुनिवर नारदजी से पूछा-॥ १॥
content.meanings: 1. tapasvii = The ascetic; vaalmiikiH = (Poet) Valmiki;paripapracCha = inquired; naaradam = Naarada; tapaH-svaadhyaayaniratam = deeply engaged in austerity and study of Vedas; varam = (and) best; vaagvidaam = among enunciators; munipungavam = (and) eminent among sages (as follows:);

content.meanings: 1. tapasvii = The ascetic; vaalmiikiH = (Poet) Valmiki;paripapracCha = inquired; naaradam = Naarada; tapaH-svaadhyaayaniratam = deeply engaged in austerity and study of Vedas; varam = (and) best; vaagvidaam = among enunciators; munipungavam = (and) eminent among sages (as follows:);

content.english: Ascetic Valmiki enquired of Narada, preeminent among the sages ever engaged in the practice of religious austerities or study of the Vedas and best among the eloquent.
